title: Urban Cycling: How to Get to Work, Save Money, and Use Your Bike for City Living
author: Madi Carlson
description: Practical guide for everyday urban cyclists, offering tips on commuting, shopping, and navigating city streets safely and confidently.

reviews.author: Bike Commuter Magazine
reviews.text: A comprehensive and accessible guide for urban cyclists of all experience levels.

reviews.author: City Cycling USA
reviews.text: Full of practical advice and real-world solutions for everyday cycling challenges.

title: Building the Cycling City: The Dutch Blueprint for Urban Vitality
author: Melissa and Chris Bruntlett
description: Explores the evolution of Dutch cycling infrastructure and culture, and provides practical lessons for transforming car-centric cities worldwide.

reviews.author: Momentum Magazine
reviews.text: Offers clear, applicable lessons from the Dutch cycling model that any city can implement.

reviews.author: Streetsblog
reviews.text: A practical blueprint for transforming urban mobility based on proven Dutch approaches.

title: Zinn & the Art of Road Bike Maintenance
author: Lennard Zinn
description: Comprehensive guide to bicycle maintenance and repair, with step-by-step instructions for everything from basic maintenance to complex repairs.

reviews.author: VeloNews
reviews.text: The definitive guide to bicycle maintenance, accessible to beginners yet detailed enough for professionals.

reviews.author: Bicycling Magazine
reviews.text: Clear, well-illustrated, and comprehensive - an essential reference for any cyclist.

title: Cycling in Asian Cities: Innovation, Integration, and Infrastructure
author: Lin Zhang
description: Comprehensive analysis of cycling trends in major Asian cities, focusing on innovative approaches to integrating cycling into urban transportation systems.

reviews.author: Asian Transport Review

reviews.author: Journal of Asian Urbanism
reviews.text: Provides essential insights into the unique challenges and opportunities for cycling in Asian contexts.
